description.narrative: The IFC will provide a medium-term loan of up to US$10 million to Unibank closed joint-stock company (the Bank) to on-lend to eligible small and medium sized enterprises in Armenia. Unibank, established in 2001, is one of leading banks in Armenia with operations across the country. The project aims to facilitate access to finance to Armenian SMEs and, hence, support recovery of the Armenian economy from the consequences of the global financial crisis. IFCs investment would be complemented by related advisory services that meet the Banks strategic needs and enhance its risk management practices and SME lending capacity. SMEs in Armenia are underserved by the banking sector due to the limited supply of long-term financing. This lack of financing is one of the reasons of the slow development of the private SME sector in the country. The proposed Project will: (i) increase the amount of funding available for SMEs, in partnership with one of Armenias leading banks, and (ii) foster competition among the Armenian banks for lending to SMEs which will support the sustainable development of the SME sector in Armenia.

The development impact of the project is expected to be significant in terms of its support for local businesses in real economy. By providing financing to the Bank, IFC will enable the Bank to expand its SME lending operations and provide commercial financing to businesses in a variety of sectors, therefore fostering economic growth through job creation. In addition, the project will have an important demonstration effect to other foreign investors. By enabling the Bank to expand its "commercially-priced" funding base, the project should have a meaningful contribution to building a viable banking system in Armenia.
